fol.307r
Decem
b
Belgia 1591: De
c
M
r
Bodley, I understand by
S
r
Robert
Sicill
and by my
Lo. Treasorer
how well yo
u
have dealt w
th
me, w
ch
I ever lookt for at
yo
r
hand
, allthough I conceaved the contrarie,
and am verie glad to se yo
r
freindshipp so
manifested unto me, Wherof I will be readie
to make requitall in all I can: For the matters
of Differaunce now betweene the
States
and me
I have heare sent a man w
th
l
er
s unto them,
Wherof I praie yo
u
to send me yo
r
oppinion, and
also what the
States
doe saie touching all thinges:/
And for the better establishing of thinges heare
according to their pleasurs, I would be verie
glad if it would please them to send yo
r
sellf or
M
r
Gillpine
joyned w
th
some other, to make
survaye of such thing
as shall be thought fit
to be refourmed.
So desiring the continuaunce
of your freindshipp, I recomend me verie
hartelie to yo
r
sellf, and c
o
mit you to the tric
o
n
of the Almightie. From Ostend this
of Decem
b
1591
Your most assured Loving freind Edward Norreys
I have sent you hearew
th
my accoumpt w
ch
if the stat
shall
[be]
satisfyed w
th
all, if it shall
[.]
them to send you Either, you shall
[.]
satisfaction:
